result.execSummary:
The defendant Kari Rae Hartl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kari Rae Hartl in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The Defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

Sentencing proceeded on the Record.  Statements made by the State,  Defense and Defendant.

On motion of the state,  the court amended the charge to Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.20(1)(b), a class A Misdemeanor.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

Defendant sentenced to serve NINETY (90) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for ZERO (0) DAYS time served.  Huber privileges for work.  Court approved Electronic Monitoring subject to HoC screening.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of ONE (1) YEAR.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

* Court ordered the defendant to serve THIRTY (30) DAYS in the House of Correction.  STAYED.  To be used at agent's discretion.  Huber privileges for work.
* Maintain stable residence.
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees WHILE ON PROBATION or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Filed,

Defendant Kari Rae Hartl in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defense advised that Defendant has had a technical error regarding paying Restitution.  Defendant has made a total of EIGHTY THOUSAND DOLLARS ($80,000.00) towards Restitution.  Defense advised that Defendant is currently employed as a bartender.  State did NOT object due to the substantial amount of Restitution.  State advised that Defendant needs to begin making MONTHLY payments towards Restition.  State advised that the victim(s) are extremely OPPOSED to extending the agreement.  With agreement of parties, Court extends Deferred Prosecution Agreement to next court date.  Case adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for August 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.
(from) Cornerstone Counseling Services.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Kari Rae Hartl in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Conference proceeded on the Record.  Defense requested a SIXTY (60) DAY adjournment to allow Defendant to continue paying restitution.  State did not object.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Rerview.  Review hearing scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kari Rae Hartl in court with attorney Jennifer R. Hellmer.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Court noted that there is a substantial amount of restitution ordered.  Defense requested to withdraw.  Defendant advised that her husband is no longer employed at the previous location.  Court GRANTS Defense Counsel's motion to WITHDRAW.  Defense advised that she is employed, but minimally so and has TWO (2) dependents as well.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Status.  Status conference scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Packet of information file stamped 02-15-2016.  Filed, sdg.
Cornerstone Counseling Services.  Filed, sdg.
To Withdraw as Counsel for Defendant.  Filed, sdg.
(of) Jennifer R. Hellmer in Support of Motion to Withdraw as Counsel for Defendant.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Kari Rae Hartl in court with attorney Jennifer R. Hellmer.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense reports that Defendant has recently been fired and has re-gained employment.  Court orders matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kari Rae Hartl in court with attorney Jennifer Renee Hellmer.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant continues to make restitution payments and is attending treatment at West Grove.

  All parties notified, effective August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Carl Ashley, Branch 33, in room 113 in the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Review hearing scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
from Cermele & Matthews, S.C., West Grove Clinic, LLC., and restitution cashier's check, received and filed.  lms

Defendant Kari Rae Hartl in court with attorney Jennifer Renee Land.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the case transferred to Judge Brostrom, Branch 6 for a review hearing on 07-14-2015 at 8:30 AM.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
FILED, Deferred Prosecution Agreement.
Defendant's counseling report prepared by Licensed Professional Counselor, James Harrison, filed by Atty. Jennifer Land on behalf

Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.

Arraignment scheduled for 04-06-2015 at 08:30 am.
